title: National Education Management System to launch in January
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya revealed that the Ministry of Education has begun implementing a National Education Management System, which is expected to be launched in January.

title: Pahala Kadugannawa closed again as night-time rock blasting continues
byline: The Colombo–Kandy main road has been closed once again from the Pahala Kadugannawa area from last evening until further notice, police said, as large rocks posing a risk are being blasted at night.

title: Cyclone Ditwah inflicts economic loss three times the tsunami damage
byline: The economic loss of Cyclone Ditwah is roughly estimated at around US $ 6 to 7 billion - more than three times the damage caused by the 2004 tsunami, an official said yesterday.

title: Children at the centre of danger after Ditwah - Experts warn
byline: With the Ditwah cyclone finally behind us and floodwaters slowly receding, health experts warn children are at the centre of danger owing to the rise in post-disaster illnesses.

title: Urgency looms as forecasted showers could affect rescue operations
byline: While rescue and evacuation operations continue across the country, officials remain alert as predicted showers could pose challenges on the ongoing operations in the coming days.

title: Government urges public to use official channels for student relief donations
byline: The Ministry of Education said that donations made to official government designated accounts will fall only under the supervision of the Ministry, together with the Ministry of Higher Education and the Ministry of Vocational Education.

title: India won’t accept humiliation: Putin slams Trump over oil trade tariffs
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday slammed Donald Trump’s administration for pressuring its trading partner India to cut back energy trade with Moscow, warning that it would backfire on Washington.

title: N. Mohammed Thahir sworn in as national list MP
byline: N. Mohamed Thahir was sworn in as a national list MP before Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne today.

title: President thanks China for disaster relief support
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has extended his deep appreciation to President Xi Jinping, the Government, and the people of China for their solidarity and generous support to Sri Lanka following the recent severe weather.

title: Kaspersky advocates proactive cybersecurity shift for Sri Lanka amid  rising threats
byline: Sri Lanka’s rapid adoption of digital technologies has ushered in tremendous opportunities for economic growth and innovation, but this accelerated digitization has simultaneously exposed critical vulnerabilities in software and infrastructure that cybercriminals are eagerly exploiting.

title: India sets up field hospital in Mahiyanganaya for flood-hit communities
byline: A fully operational field hospital has been established in Mahiyanganaya, near Kandy, by an Indian medical team to support flood-affected communities with urgent healthcare needs.

title: Putin says Russia will take Donbas by force or Ukraine’s troops will withdraw
byline: President Vladimir Putin has warned again that Ukrainian troops must withdraw from Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region or Russia will seize it, rejecting any compromise over how to end the war in Ukraine.

title: Puttalam Line Train Services Extended to Nattandiya
byline: Train services on the Puttalam line will now be extended to Nattandiya following the completion of repair work between Kochchikade and Nattandiya, the Railways Department said.

title: SLTB allows train season ticket holders to use SLTB buses temporarily
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has announced that commuters holding train season tickets can temporarily travel on SLTB buses following the suspension of train services due to the recent cyclone.

title: NTC takes action against bus crew for endangering passengers in floods
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has disciplined the Monaragala-Colombo bus owner, driver, and conductor for putting passengers at risk while traveling through flooded areas in Kumbukkana.

title: Government to relocate displaced people in safer locations: Minister
byline: The government has paid special attention on relocating the displaced people in safer locations rather than settling them in their original locations, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala said today.

title: Cyclone Ditwah damages 416 factories: Government allocates Rs. 3 billion for immediate assistance
byline: The Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Ministry has reported that 416 manufacturing and export factories across Sri Lanka have been affected by Cyclone Ditwah. The ministry has proposed providing 25% of the total damages to the affected factories immediately.

title: Meteorological Department head threatened by Defence Secretary: MP
byline: The Defence Secretary has summoned the head of the Meteorological Department to his office and had threatened him, asking him to refrain from making statements to the media, Opposition MP Ranjith Madduma Bandara told Parliament today.

title: Rupees 10 billion allocated for cash compensation for disaster hit people: Minister
byline: A sum of Rs. 10 billion has been allocated to pay cash compensation to all disaster affected persons, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: Police recover $19k Fabergé egg swallowed by NZ man
byline: A diamond-studded locket swallowed by a New Zealand man who tried to steal it has been ’’recovered’’, police say.

title: Over 28,000 tri-forces personnel deployed for nationwide relief operations
byline: More than 28,300 tri-forces personnel have been deployed across the country to support rescue and relief efforts following the severe floods and landslides triggered by recent adverse weather, the Special Disaster Operations Media Centre said.

title: US widens travel ban to more than 30 countries, Noem says
byline: The US plans to expand the number of countries covered by its travel ban to more than 30, US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said on Thursday (Dec 4).

title: Government using emergency regulations to suppress social media: Kabir
byline: The Opposition today alleged that the government is using the emergency regulations to suppress social media instead of using them for the benefit of the affected people.

title: Man who killed ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe apologises to his family
byline: The man accused of assassinating former Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe has apologised to the ex-leader’s family for the first time.

title: 'X Press Pearl' case before Singaporean courts temporarily halted: Minister
byline: The X Press Pearl case which was pending before Singaporean courts has been halted temporarily, Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayalkara told Parliament today.

title: Foreigner bitten by monkey, performer arrested
byline: A gypsy who staged a performance by a macaque and a cobra in Unawatuna beach ended up in a police cell when a tourist in his audience was bitten by the macaque.

title: Navy seizes foreign cigarettes and cosmetics in Delft seas
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has recovered a large consignment of foreign cigarettes and other contraband items during a special search operation carried out in the seas south of Delft, Jaffna, yesterday.

title: Vegetable shortage expected, prices set to rise - traders warn
byline: Some stocks of vegetables that survived the recent cyclone are currently reaching the market but there will be a shortage soon, a trader attached to the Manning Market said yesterday.

title: Indian drone technology firm offers support for Sri Lanka’s disaster response
byline: An Indian technology company specialising in drone operations for disaster response and geospatial mapping has offered technical assistance to Sri Lanka to strengthen its disaster-management capacities.

title: India won’t accept humiliation: Putin slams Trump over oil trade tariffs
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday slammed Donald Trump’s administration for pressuring its trading partner India to cut back energy trade with Moscow, warning that it would backfire on Washington.

title: Korea pledges USD 500,000 in emergency relief for Sri Lanka’s cyclone-hit communities
byline: The Government of the Republic of Korea has pledged USD 500,000 to support emergency relief efforts in Sri Lanka following the severe impact of tropical cyclone Ditwah.

title: Court rejects former Mahaweli Authority Director General’s anticipatory bail application
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today rejected the anticipatory bail application filed by former Director General of the Sri Lanka Mahaweli Authority, Keerthi B. Kotagama.

title: CBSL issues advisory on handling flood-affected currency notes
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) issued a public advisory on how to handle wet or flood affected currency notes, in the aftermath of the recent floods that devastated the country.

title: Beat forest officer remanded over Rs. 10,000 bribe
byline: A beat forest officer suspected of accepting a bribe of Rs. 10,000 to issue a permit related to cutting timber was today remanded till December 12 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: Partially, fully damaged houses to get maximum Rs. 2.5 million compensation: Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Defence Aruna Jayasekera said the government will provide compensation subject to a maximum of Rs. 2.5 million to houses that have been partially or fully damaged due to recent disaster.

title: VFS Global extends support to Sri Lanka’s flood relief efforts
byline: Reaffirming its long-standing partnership with Sri Lanka, VFS Global has extended support to the country’s official flood relief efforts, offering financial assistance and mobilising employees to help affected families.

title: The FIFA World Cup 2026 draw is here - this is how it will work
byline: Pots, quadrants, confederation constraints, group position grids... the 2026 World Cup finals draw on Friday is not going to be a straightforward affair.

title: 'I was rescued by war heroes’: Archchuna
byline: Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna said today that he was rescued by the war heroes when he was caught in the floods.

title: Tanzanian woman gives birth at BIA
byline: A 29-year-old Tanzanian woman gave birth at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) after arriving from Dubai this morning.

title: Court suspends unauthorised production of novella ’Mai Maara Prasangaya’
byline: The Colombo Commercial High Court issued several enjoining orders against several vendors and booksellers engaged in the unauthorised reproduction and public distribution of the novella ’Mai Maara Prasangaya’ authored and published by popular novelist Mahinda Prasad Masimbula.

title: Independent Local Government member’s hand bitten by NPP politician
byline: A National People’s Power (NPP) politician allegedly bit the hand of an independent Local Government member during a dispute over the distribution of lunch packets to flood victims in Kaduwela, MP D.V. Chanaka revealed in Parliament today.

title: Severe lightning warning issued for 15 districts
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a red alert for severe lightning in parts of the country, including the Western and Sabaragamuwa Provinces, and the Galle and Matara districts, effective until 11.00 p.m. today.

title: Putin says Russia will take Donbas by force or Ukraine’s troops will withdraw
byline: President Vladimir Putin has warned again that Ukrainian troops must withdraw from Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region or Russia will seize it, rejecting any compromise over how to end the war in Ukraine.

title: US widens travel ban to more than 30 countries, Noem says
byline: The US plans to expand the number of countries covered by its travel ban to more than 30, US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said on Thursday (Dec 4).

title: Fully damaged houses to get Rs. 5 million as compensation: President
byline: The government will provide Rs. 5 million as compensation for fully damaged houses, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced today.

title: Government planning to get IMF sixth tranche increased: President
byline: The government has negotiated with the International Monitory Fund (IMF) to increase the amount of the sixth tranche which was due in December this month, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Budget 2026 passed
byline: Budget 2026 was passed with a majority of 157 votes with 158 MPs voting for and one member voting against.

title: Market faces sharp decline amid disaster concerns
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange witnessed another challenging session on Thursday, as investor sentiment was weighed down by adverse weather conditions and ongoing assessments of the disaster’s impact. Caution prevailed in the market, with muted trading volumes and turnover reflecting investors’ hesitancy amid uncertainty.

title: WHO issues guidance on handling dead animals after floods
byline: The World Health Organization (WHO) Sri Lanka has issued public health guidelines on the safe management of dead animals found during or after flooding, following recent adverse weather conditions across the country.

title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros film and streaming businesses for $72bn
byline: Netflix has agreed to buy the film and streaming businesses of Warner Bros Discovery for $72bn (£54bn) in a major Hollywood deal.

title: President says emergency laws will not be used to curb free expression
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake assured Parliament today that emergency regulations will not be invoked to suppress freedom of expression or criticism of the government.

title: Inclement weather claims 607 deaths, over two million affected
byline: A total of 607 persons have died while 214 remain missing due to the severe weather, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: Give priority to international donor conference: SJB
byline: The government should give priority to holding an international donor  conference in order to get assistance from foreign countries to rebuild the nation, an Opposition MP said today.

title: Sri Lankans have shown solidarity with disaster  affected people by donating blood
byline: The Sri Lankan people have shown solidarity with the disaster hit people by generously donating blood, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament today.

title: Maldives donates 14 containers of Tuna to Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka received a consignment of canned tuna as relief for the people affected by the adverse weather from the Maldives today, reflecting the strong partnership and regional solidarity between the two nations.

title: IMF considers US 200 million under Rapid Financing Instrument  for Sri Lanka
byline: The International Monetary Fund ( IMF) is considering Sri Lanka’s request for US $ 200 million  under the Rapid Financing Instrument (RFI), according to Evan Papageorgiou, its Mission   Chief for Sri Lanka.

title: Ball rolled into pitch forces WBBL match to be called off
byline: Bizarrre scenes in Adelaide during the innings break in the Strikers-Hurricanes clash saw the match abandoned, a result that keeps alive the Strikers’ finals hopes

title: Fakhar Zaman found guilty of breaching ICC Code of Conduct
byline: Pakistan batter, Fakhar Zaman has been fined 10 per cent of his match fee after he was found guilty of breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the Tri-Series final against Sri Lanka on 29 November.
